quiz.title: Algebra 2: Unit 12 Quiz 7
quiz.subtitle: 12.7: Solving Trigonometric Equations with Multiple Angles
quiz.subject: Mathematics

questions.question: How many solutions does $\sin(2x) = 1/2$ have on the interval $[0, 2\pi)$?
questions.explanation: A standard $\sin(x)$ equation has 2 solutions in one rotation. Since the frequency is doubled ($2x$), there are $2 \times 2 = 4$ solutions.

questions.question: Solve $\cos(2x) = 1$ on the interval $[0, 2\pi)$.
questions.explanation: Set $2x = 0$ and $2x = 2\pi$. Dividing by 2 gives $x = 0$ and $x = \pi$.

questions.question: What is the first step in solving $\tan(3x) = 1$?
questions.explanation: Always find the angles where the tangent is 1 first for the argument $3x$ before isolating $x$.

questions.question: Solve $2\sin(x/2) - 1 = 0$ on the interval $[0, 2\pi)$.
questions.explanation: $\sin(x/2) = 1/2$. This means $x/2 = \pi/6$ or $5\pi/6$. Multiplying by 2 gives $x = \pi/3$ or $5\pi/3$. Both are within the interval.

questions.question: Solve $\sin(3x) = 0$ on $[0, \pi]$.
questions.explanation: $3x = 0, \pi, 2\pi, 3\pi$. Dividing by 3 gives $x = 0, \pi/3, 2\pi/3, \pi$. All four are in the interval $[0, \pi]$.

questions.question: If $\tan(2x) = \sqrt{3}$, what is the smallest positive value of $x$?
Which of the following is a solution to $2\cos(2x) + \sqrt{2} = 0$?
Solve $\sec(2x) = 2$ on the interval $[0, \pi]$.
questions.explanation: $\cos(2x) = 1/2$. So $2x = \pi/3$ or $5\pi/3$. Dividing by 2 gives $x = \pi/6$ and $5\pi/6$.

questions.question: When solving $\sin(Bx) = c$, how is the general solution period modified?
questions.explanation: When you divide the angle by $B$, you must also divide the period $2n\pi$ by $B$ to find all solutions.

scoreMessages.90: Excellent! You handled the multiple angles perfectly.
scoreMessages.70: Good. Remember to divide the entire general solution by the coefficient.
scoreMessages.50: Be careful! Don't divide the trig function value; divide the angle value.
scoreMessages.0: Review the concept of frequency and how it increases the number of solutions.
